page.title: 12Steyning Language/Customs
page.content: {STEANINGAS}is the old Saxon word for Steyning.It means 'people who live by a stone'.Perhaps it was the stone which Cuthman threw down when he came to Steyning. {Dialect}is a language which has been kept in use from Saxon times.Here are some words which are still used; {TWITTEN}is used all over Sussex and means a narrow path between hedges or brick walls often leading from one road to another. {SILLY}comes from a Saxon word{SAELIG} which means 'blessed or innocent' {CUSTOMS IN SUSSEX There are lots of customs from long ago.One is{CUCKOO PENNY}which is that in spring when you heard a cuckoo for the first time you should turn a penny in your pocket because you will have money in your pocket until the next year when you heard a cuckoo again.
